result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey George Love

records.addlTxt:
10:10 AM Defendant Jeffrey George Love in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Jeffrey George Love.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. State notes agreement and asks for a plea/sentencing. Attorney Hoffman in agreement.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

$500cb already posted/reinstated
Comply with all Sex Offender Registry requirements.

Calling cases 22CF165 and 21CF502

4:00 PM Defendant Jeffrey George Love appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Jeffrey George Love.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant's address confirmed. Court quashes warrant; questions non appearance.
Defendant lets the court know that a family member died. when he realized he missed court he just sat at home not knowing what to do.  Has never missed court.
State requests 1000cb on each file. Had a late appearance-no warrant issued at hearing and then a non appearance where the warrants issued.

Court confirms what State is requesting-States request as additional $1000 in each case.
Attorney makes argument; family member illness. Got the date of hearing mixed up and didn't know what to do. up until this time had been a very studious person coming to court. No means of income.
Court reviews history of case and appearances, cites concerns; serious charges. 
Court vacates the forf of bail/bonds and orders additional $1500cb in each file and reinstates $500cb already posted in 22CF165. (making the total cash bail for 22CF165 $2000) Orders that all prior conditions ordered in each case continue.
Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:13 AM Defendant Jeffrey George Love not in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Jeffrey George Love.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hoffman has no information. State requests warrant and forfeiture of bail/bond in 21CF502 and 22CF165 Court orders warrant and forfeiture of bail/bond  in 21CF502 and 22CF165.

9:37 AM Defendant Jeffrey George Love not in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Jeffrey George Love.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Attorney Hoffman has no information. State requests warrant and forfeiture in both files. So ordered.

Court recalls case at 9:46 AM. Defendant appears. Court quashes warrant, rescinds forfeiture. Defendant indicates has been in hospital.
Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:35 AM Defendant Jeffrey George Love in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Jeffrey George Love. Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Acknowledge receipt, waives reading, pleads not guilty. Court accepts plea. Has offer but wants to make counter off. Asks for status. Court sets date.
Status conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
10:00 AM Defendant Jeffrey George Love in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Jeffrey George Love. Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney states their client wishes to waive their right to the preliminary hearing. Defendant agrees. Court accepts waiver of the Defendant's right to a preliminary hearing as knowingly and voluntarily made. Court finds probable case and binds the defendant over for arraignment. Court reminds the Defendant of their bail conditions. Defendant orally confirms he has received date and time of hearing and confirms he will attend. Defendant provided notice.
Arraignment scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Comply with all sex offender registry requirements.

1:47 PM Defendant Jeffrey George Love appeared by video, in custody. 
Defendant's address confirmed. Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading. Requests prelim hrg 
State ask $500 cb and keep sex offender registry updated. State reviews criminal history, limited but long history, on signature bond on current open file.
 Atty Hoffman states Douglas county resident his whole life. He does not have any money he can post. Court orders $500 cash bail with conditions of comply with all sex offender registry requirements.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 09:45 am.
